Review.Titre: Fonus has switched to Fonus Ltd
Review.Contenu: Fonus has switched to Fonus Ltd.  For 3 months in a row they have been double billing me.  Customer service says they can do nothing to fix it or stop it.  They want me to call my credit card company every month and have the charges reverses.  The credit card company says they can't block the double billing from occurring but they have now reported it to their fraud unit.  Can you imagine!  A company knowingly double billing all it's Customers and doing nothing to stop it.

Recently, they gave me policy violation of excessive data usage and disconnect my service. On website posted unlimited data but it’s not. Now I am asking to refund my money, but they are declining.

Review.Titre: This is actually my 2nd review as Fonus…
Review.Contenu: This is actually my 2nd review as Fonus was somehow able to take my first review down and I didn't reply to trustpilot in time to have it stopped.  I bought 2 fonus sim cards and when we were about to travel to the US I tried to activate but their activation server was down.  It took them 2 days of me chatting with them before an agent even admitted to me that the activation server was down.  So not really sure how good the service is but do know you can't rely on them.  Thank god for T-mobile and if you are in Canada Public mobile now has a plan $40 for 40 gigs that works in both Canada and the USA but with a real phone number not a voip one.I should also mention a bunch of other people also stated the activation servers were down and I have to wonder if they were able to remove those reviews as well.

Review.Titre: Scam.. still charge credit card even after port out and refuse to refund
Review.Contenu: Scam.. still charge credit card even after port out and refuse to refundUnable to receive any message text from bank or other institutions. Unable to receive text for verification purposes.3/4 of call drops. False advertising as data is not unlimited as advertised because they send warning email when you use 40 GB but the thing is all calls and text go through fonus apps which use a lot of data as fonus is not like traditional carrier, fonus use LTE data for calls and you will quickly reach the 40GB even if you don't stream video. Poorest customer service of all time.

Review.Contenu: Terrible App, which is the centerstone of their service, exclude everything your OS is running. Zero compatible with OS functions, even just calling a google searched place. Been coping with a 12+ days of text and call outage and the customer service is awful. Same answer everyday "give us 24-72hr" to fully restore service. still nothing works 12 days later and I cannot change of carrier because the phone number port out service is affected too by this outage. So I am stuck with them and it doesn't work...great!

Review.Titre: Not true unlimited streaming
Review.Contenu: I've been using it for emails, social media, and Netflix,  YouTube no phone calls or texts yet . At 30GB I was cut off (after just under 3 weeks of use). I received a warning email . Unlimited so long as you don't use too much. They said in the email this was a direct violation to fonus fair use policy,  they reserve the right to limit,  suspend or terminate without notice.

Review.Titre: Absolutely terrible experience with…
Review.Contenu: Absolutely terrible experience with fonus. I supported Fonus when the initially launched their service. They assured me a lifetime service as I was the first 500 to qualify for their lifetime service after paying them the initial fee. I sent multiple requests to active my sim and have ticket numbers associated with my request. My sim was never activated upon my request and they never resolved my ticket. This company is a scam, after reaching out to them many times with proof of my conversations they never delivered their promises. You are much better off paying for a service that delivers on their promises and service. Would not recommend throwing their money away on fonus to anyone.Please feel free to reach out for any documentation you require.

Review.Titre: I've been a happy customer till now
Review.Contenu: I've been a very happy customer for several months. But by Dec 15, 2002, I wasn't able to send or receive calls or texts. Data is fine. Oddly, I am able to call my wife, but she gets a busy signal when she calls me. I noticed the loss of service around the time the big storm came through many of the central/eastern states, and I figured that AT&T's outage was affecting our service.  But that turns out not to be the case because data remains good, but receiving calls and sending and receiving texts doesn't work.

Review.Titre: This app is horrible on android phones
Review.Contenu: This app is horrible on android phones, they seemed to be geared to the iPhone market. If you logout you loose all text messages older than,24 hours. I was unable to make phone calls and tech  support were unable to resolve the problem. When I got ticked off because I lost all my text messages and still could not make phone calls they refused to help me. I have tried the sync messages option they state below but I am still missing all messages prior to Oct 8th (the last time tech support told me to logout)

Review.Titre: NO REFUND!!
Review.Contenu: After finding out that my calling /messaging features  on my Iphone with Fonus would be altered and I would not be able to use it like normal I attempted to cancel the service.They showed me how to do it and followed through with it and confirmed it.I noticed that they deducted from my bank account and logged back on there website to see my account was active again.Took 3 days to get a response and they will not refund my money! They said there a prepaid company and cannot refund me! It was there website error and they will not honour it.I STRONGLY recommend staying away from this company!

Review.Titre: My phone has been ringing busy since at…
Review.Contenu: My phone has been ringing busy since at least yesterday.  Tried chat only to receive message about busier than normal call volumes etc. to try later which I have been doing with no luck.  Located a customer support number and got a recording about an update which required me to reconfigure my apn setting and to visit a website.  Unfortunately I couldn't hear the website name it was garbled.  Followed the instructions on my phone to reset the apn and that didn't work.  Emailed them and got the same reply about agents being busy and to try again later.  I'm having no trouble with the mobile data, just the phone. At this point I'd like to cancel but can't figure out how to do that either.  My opinion of fonus is that when it works it's great but I sure wouldn't do it again.

Review.Titre: Number unavailable for 3 days
Review.Contenu: Number unavailable for two days. Help centre gives automated “it will soon work” . Can’t afford to not have a phone unavailable. Not doing anything to fix my problem. STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY!Now the 3rd day and no action to get my phone working. And YES I auto pay my bill.All I get from Fonus is- Thank you for contacting our customer support team. We are currently experiencing a high volume of requests and all of our agents are busy assisting other customers. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. We understand that there is a service outage currently affecting some of our customers where calling and texting features may not work properly and we are working diligently to fix it as soon as possible.Please try contacting us again later and one of our agents will be happy to assist you as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience and understanding and we look forward to helping you.

Review.Titre: Works like a scam company!!!!
Review.Contenu: Charge double what any other phone provider charges for a SIM ($20+CAD), then instantly charge you for a month ($40+CAD). They refuse to port your phone number, and only offer phone numbers that aren't even close to your location. My actual area code doesn't even exist in their system.So now I have no service, no number, and I'm out $60. SCAM company!!!!ETA: They delete negative reviews from their Facebook posts (and I'm sure other social media as well). They just deleted mine, that had stated the same thing about costs and now I have no phone service and am out that $60. This is not an honest company at all! Don't trust their reviews, as they are clearly adjusted by the company.

Review.Titre: Fonus customer service are totally out to lunch!
Review.Contenu: I appreciated getting a phone call from the hospital who were trying to reach my wife for an emergency procedure. They told me the line was disconnected!  I tried her cell twice with the same response. Finally got through to Fonus customer service to be advised that she should put her phone on airplane mode for two minutes.  Excuse me…the line is disconnected! How do I reach her??Finally the representative does some action on there end and it gets cleared up. This is not the first time they are having internal issues. I asked what the issue is and was told because it’s a new payment system.  Well that’s a standard response these days.As her service was down I sought compensation for the outage period and got the perfect response “We can’t do that because We are a prepaid company “.  Huh? You take my money on a monthly basis but can’t make an adjustment in my favour because you have internal problems?What kind of logic is that Fonus?What kind of squirrels are running the company?

Review.Titre: This is the worst app and the worst…
Review.Contenu: This is the worst app and the worst phone company I have ever had to deal with.  My app is not working most of the day. I have to restart the phone 2 times a day to get service. When I get service I can't hear callers and they can't hear me. I complained about the service and the US dollar pricing and a manager named Stuart threatened me that customer service will not help me if I insinuate that they false advertise costumer service will not help me anymore.  Porting in and out is a nightmare because fonus is a landline.

Review.Titre: Not true unlimited
Review.Contenu: I've been using mine to web surf, check emails, social media, and Netflix as well as YouTube. I would download in batches to avoid long periods of consistent use. At 40GB I was cut off (after just under 3 weeks of use). This was within minutes of receiving a warning email that I didn't immediately notice. Unlimited so long as you don't use too much. They include a statistic in the email about using more than 99.5% of other users, a stat which they control since they can cancel at any time. This would suggest they only keep clients who use less than 40 GB per month. I hope they're smart enough to not charge me again (others claim to have this experience). I've also seen them respond to other peoples posts and publicly reveal details about their account (such as usage details). It seems they're looking for people who want unlimited but won't use it. If you plan to stream, you'll need to monitor your usage.  Depending on your video quality you'll get 5-10 hours per week of streamed content before they give you the chop.

Review.Titre: Very bad service
Review.Contenu: Very bad service, (1) this is a VIRTUAL wireless service. So, the quality of the line cannot be better than Fongo, Messenger, Viber, WhatApps, Google Hangout, etc. Those other virtual services, ARE NORMALLY FREE OR REALLY CHEAP, so why pay for  Fonus ??)... (2) You have to use Fonus App to do everything, the problem is that the app offered by Fonus is realy bad, for instance, it cannot pass from wifi to wireless automatically, you will have to do this manually. and each time you do this, if you are on the phone, the line will cut !!! the service always cut for may other unclear reasons. Furthermore, It does not work well with other technology like Bluetooth, Microsoft Your Phone, etc. The contact list is hard to use on the Fonus App, it's even hard to hang after you make a call (the screen often disappears and it's impossible to get it back). If you use this service, be prepared to restart your phone 3-4 times per day and miss at least 30% of your call. I wanted to encourage a new business, but I do not recommend.

Review.Contenu: It's waste for your money/time.Be careful to avoid this service - because- it does not support tethering - you can dial from your car dashboard.- when you are on one call, the second call peeps in but no caller information provided.- call history takes time to update- Call drops every now and then.- No telephone support - No online support - if you keep chasing them when you do not get the service you are supposed to get.- it takes for weeks to port in / port out your number.- Very poor customer service - This is a Voip landline number but they call it Fonus mobile.

Review.Titre: Very weak customer service and worse experience with their support
Review.Contenu: Sadly 99% of the time customer service has a glib answer that does not resolve the issue. Case in point, porting phone numbers. Two of my phones were released from the original carrier on a Wednesday, a week later after hounding customer service it was finally resolved. Another was instead of sending a call to one telephone they set it up so that the same number was put on 2 different phones. My wife’s telephone number was effectively placed in limbo so she couldn’t receive calls from the hospital about her ailing mother.On another note I’m still trying to understand how they can only supply under 8mpps download speeds with AT&T in Texas. I’m not in the hinterlands I’m in an area of the Rio Grande Valley  Surely it is populaces enough to offer more than that?It has been slow and difficult to get resolution from them. Just setting up my phone and my wife’s took more than 20 hours of online dilly dallying. That’s unacceptable.  Guess I’m the dummy for hoping that this company might be offering a reasonable service at a very competitive price, but unfortunately they fail when it comes to service and supportToo bad really.I will add to this that the one bright exception to the above is Bruce in Customer service who never fails to provide unwavering support with the challenges of getting the phones (2) to work. He is thoughtful and knows his stuff. Hope Fonus can clone him soon   He is their saving grace.

Review.Titre: I've had this service for 2 months now
Review.Contenu: I've had this service for 2 months now. It worked seamlessly when I went across the border.Having issues with calls both inbound and outbound. Calls are very spotty and sometimes I have to hang up and call back.The app connects to the car but I cannot hear the person.When on wifi the service is still choppy on calls.When I leave the house I have to restart the app in order for it to work.I've asked multiple times about my issues and its always" we've sent your issues to our tech team and we'll get back to you". Still waiting. I suspect they have no fix.I've used many other so-called voip apps and they all work much better. I'm switching out of this application to another cell provider and I'll figure out something when across the border.I do have to say that Anna and Bruce are very good as customer service agents but the problem fonus has is with the stability of what they offer.Too bad though the price is goodAs of today Dec 20 2021 Fonus still has not come back to me with any potential fix to the issues, as I suspected they have none, nor have they contaced me either. I am switching carriers since they do not appear to want to keep customers

Review.Titre: Worst Costumer Service experience as a paid client
Review.Contenu: Worst Costumer Service experience one could imagine as a paid client. After a fairly good short experience (I'm in Canada only 3G, LTE sometimes here) I tried to reactivate the SIM card when I was about to travel to the US, where I've heard works as it is promised (5G).1) Contacted with a Costumer Service Supervisor and I was misled to believe they cannot reactivate SIM cards on weekends (?), they had to "refresh" my SIM card with AT&T (??), and no, they could not do anything else. 2) They made me wait for 3 days during a long weekend, and even after paying for one more month I never received a notification saying the SIM card was reactivated... the same day I paid!3) With frustration, I requested the cancellation and refund, since I never used it.4) A Costumer Service Supervisor named Bruce arrogantly, not only cancelled my account without an explanation on why I was told no reactivation on weekends, but informed me YOU will not get a refund after he cancelled my account. This "company" sells SIM cards but resells a service provided by AT&T, but in terms of Costumer Service you are better treated if you deal with an actual professional support team, and Fonus does not provide but misleading excuses, then cancels you as a client, but keeps your money, since they don't refund for a service that was not used.Trailblazer Mr. Simon Tian. Nice chatting with you on Telegram, BTW --I was expecting a more CEO kind of intervention from you in this matter.

Review.Titre: Did not work for traveling!
Review.Contenu: Worked OK in Canada but far from how it was advertised. I travel across North America and thought would be a great way to keep in touch with important.  However once I left Canada only the data/text portion seemed to work, which can easily get free apps that do that.  I was able to make one outgoing call from Mexico and received another from Canada but beyond that it wouldn't allow me to make or receive calls, they would not even dial out.  Customer service was less than helpful as they would each tell me to restart the phone or reboot the app, then got very snarky and argumentative when I asked to cancel.  I simply asked to cancel because it didn't work for me, I didn't ask for a refund, they replied that they would not provide a refund, although offering to provide some sort of refund or forward moving solution would of made sense, I got more of a snarky response about how it works for others and that no refund would be provided.Despite their reply, multiple force stops, reboots and reinstall of the fonus app did not work, and their responses when I asked to cancel were extremely snarky and passive aggressive. Was going to return if they fixed their issues, but definitely not with their level of customer service.I've also read their great reviews and highly suspect the way they are written is from their own employees, mainly Bruce who in reality was a very passive aggressive person and belongs nowhere near any sort of customer service department.Another further update is that if you wonder how they get all the great reviews on Facebook, they delete all critical comments then block them from commenting, even if constructive on how to improve their service,  very shady company!

Sad

Review.Titre: Bad support and horrible experience…
Review.Contenu: SCAM ! Bad support and horrible experience Overall. I ordered sim in Nov 2019 and got it in June 2020. Was offered free for lifetime service but after contacting support to activate there is no response for almost over a month now.

Review.Titre: No service
Review.Contenu: I have been using the service for about a month at first it was working great but than it stopped completely now no service. Waiting for fonus customer service for a resolutionn

Review.Titre: Really bad support and service. False advertising
Review.Contenu: Really bad support and service.Initially, it wasn't good as I was harassed almost every day by AT&T calls.It never stopped but they told me everything was okay..Then yesterday, my sim card has been deactivated for no reason.My account isn't accessible anymore.Noone answers me on their chat support.So, if someone still dares to make business with this poor company, keep in mind they could cut their services at any time, without giving you any reason whatsoever, not even a REFUND.It is raging when it happens in the middle of a paid month.Update March 2021 :I gave their V3 sim a try and it is worse than before.You cannot reach any cel phone in Europe and Asia and vice versa. Poor quality calls to any fixed phone on these same continents.I rarely get 4g connection in town.I've posted a comment on their marvellous Facebook Fonus Club to compare with other users and I have been kicked out.Pretty dishonest as dishonest as they actual offer which is a false advertising.False advertising is called a scam.

Review.Titre: IAM Fonus lifetime free customer and my…
Review.Contenu: IAM Fonus lifetime free customer and my service is not active Last two month , I complained to support team still not responding

Review.Titre: Haven't received the Sim yet. Been 8 months
Review.Contenu: I paid for the sim in December 2019. I haven't received any email except for the receipt.

Review.Titre: I bought the sim to check out what the…
Review.Contenu: I bought the sim to check out what the company actually offers.Sim recived in a few days, great. But when i activated the sim with the CCID AND IMEI. Everythingwent through smoothly, credit card was charged and even stated on on Fonus account as successful charged, but the sim was in disconnected status. It was on the weekend, so customer supports stated that activation department doesn't work on the weekend. OK, fair.... i waited till end of day on Monday. Still "deactivated" on my Fonus account.Then i reached out on Tuesday,  im giving the  your activation is pending due to too many activations. End of day of Tuesday, still nothing.Wednesday,  i tried again with the chat support. I asked the chat support person, how long does it take to activate the sim. The answer was 24-48 hours. Ok, so i stated my business that i paid on the 19th and now its the 22nd, so what happened to my activation?PROOF OF PURCHASE as asked again. CCID and IMEI was given as well. What i got back was. Wait another 24 hours then try again. Seriously, what kind of a telecom company takes 4 days to activate a sim. Im at the point of trying to do a chargeback on the company.* response to Fonus's reply: the reason i bought the sim is to try put what your company has to offer. That intention is still there. All i wanted is an active sim. I don't care about the month that you mention.

Review.Titre: Stay far far away from any of this guy's companies
Review.Contenu: Paid with credit card, went through eventually. In 2019 it was advertising these key features-Canadian numbers with the sim-unthrottled data (unlimited)-Canadian number port-in-world roaming (not that important for me, but it'd be nice for vacations)Now, I have a sim that works relatively well but none of these features are available. I was told that now I have to download a VOIP app to get them. I already have a voip app. He also wouldn't activate my sim unless I followed him on Facebook and liked the pictures that he posts... He's also admitted that he's been arrested multiple times in the last year for weapons charges in Singapore and has posted videos of himself swearing at the Japanese police outside their police station. How this is news that legitimizes his company, who knows? Currently unlimited data is working and speeds are temperamental but when it's working, it's fast.Credit card is cancelled just in case as Simon has the reputation of being a scammer.Please do not purchase this without doing your research on Simon Tian's history first. Pay with an e-visa if you decide to purchase. I've also heard that he will be removing features such as phone calls and text messaging and we will have to use the voip app only. Not what was originally promised. This is worse than the Neptune smart watch where he scammed all his crowdfunders. Please look all of this up.He also has a history if purchasing reddit votes, twitter followers, and positive reviews....

Review.Titre: The internet service is okay
Review.Contenu: The internet service is okay. The phone and text service is very discouraging. I live in Canada, Toronto area, and there are occasions when the service is intermittent

Review.Titre: -Phone call is a real…problem
Review.Contenu: -Phone call is a real problem....there's always a delay with me and the speaker on the line....-I must reset each day the apps to do inside and outside call -some Phone numéro are not take in charge by Fonus-Internet is very good

Review.Titre: Company needs to update their app to…
Review.Contenu: Company needs to update their app to make sure no calls and text messages are missed and properly sent out. Cancelled fonus a couple days ago due to failure to fix issue of messages not sending out after requesting twice to be fixed from Anne on online customer support chat.Was with them over 2 years but due to failure to update app and fix important issues it is no longer a good fit.

Review.Titre: Fonus is in the process of changing its…
Review.Contenu: Fonus is in the process of changing its billing system.. for months now.. so phone numbers keep getting disconnected and caller calling my phone(s) get the message that the number is disconnected. This has been happening for months now. Ask for a credit, and told No credit.. its a prepaid system.. since we reactivated your line, you are good to go. Fonus is missing the point! Inconvenience, no incoming calls, people thinking your line is disconnected etc etc. Don’t ask for a manager, cause apparently they do not exist. One unhappy Fonus customer! Asked for a $20.00 credit on each line… NOPE! Nada, zip, zilch given to make up for the multiple months of inconvenience. Told the billing system is fixed now.. so let’s see moving forward what grief is incurred.

Review.Titre: Less than forthright.
Review.Contenu: The service itself may be fine...but the presentation of what it is seems less than forthright.  The phone service is VOIP over Data services.  This means (for iPhone users) that things like iMessage or WhatsApp are unable to use the Fonus service. (Note that they can be used with WiFi, so long as you switch your ID to your email address - but that is NOT using Fonus)  It also means that texts from systems with International restrictions also wont come through.The customer service is OK, but the tech support is marginal. Be prepared to figure things out on your own.But the biggest reason for the 2 star rating is that they were not at all clear about the technical underpinnings and resulting limitations.

Review.Titre: After 6 months of use still many issues not corrected
Review.Contenu: After months of use, I am living the extremes with FONUS.  Price, coverage, and data services are beyond what we expected.  On the other hand, voice connections are often very poor quality.  we have 2 iPhones with them and all too often my wife's phone will instantly go to voice mail.  Another recurring issue is when I try to call her phone from mine, there appears to be a configuration conflict and the call will not connect.  Even went so far as to change both phones to upgrade.  Still no improvement.  The solution offered is to refresh the phone.  Just wondering how many times a day, week or month we will have to play this game to overcome these technical problems?  I wish that our relationship of more than 6 months with Fonus was addressed properly!

Review.Titre: Customer service Great! Phone service... Not so much :(
Review.Contenu: Customer service is speedy and excellent, but thats where my good experience ends. Since having it, my calls sometimes never make it to my phone, it drops calls all the time. It may be a bit my samsung A70s fault too as since the android 11 update its been a $h!t show. I cannot continue with this service if I will be missing important calls.

Review.Titre: Poor call and text experience
Review.Contenu: Poor call and text experience. Took nearly a month to port my Canadian number. Fonus runs calls and texts through their own app which is brutal. Can't search for a business and press the number to call. Have to enter it manually in the App. Calls are frequently dropped and missed. Texts sometimes take 30 minutes to show-up (which is awesome when you're waiting for a verficiation code that expires in 15 minutes). The data option is awesome, but not worth it for a daily user who makes lots of calls and texts.

Review.Titre: Wanted Fonus to work for me
Review.Contenu: Wanted Fonus to work for me. In principal Fonus sounds good however there were too many problems for me to overcome on my own. Although the chat support was there they were not able to sort out the problems. They are in a unique VOIP cell market and should be able to sort out these various problems far better than they do. I will try them again in a couple years to see if they are closer to meeting my needs. In the meantime I'm back to my traditional provider.Roger DCalgary

Review.Titre: They sub-contracted out my number, making it very hard to leave
Review.Contenu: I had less than consistent ability to use my phone for calls while with Fonus: two things would happen. 1) some calls were just not allowed through (a few people told me when they called they got a busy signal, even when I wasn't on the phone)2) when I tried to call, sometimes the wifi signal was just too poor. Despite my city being covered by Fonus's networkThe really frustrating part was trying to leave. Fonus goes through a third-party for their VOIP phone plans. And when I tried to leave Fonus, and wanted to port my number out (something that takes about 1 day normally)...it ended up taking 3 weeks and lots of phone calls to their third-party provider (and to make things even worse, they had sold my number to another sub-contractor, who stalled on releasing my number). *Edit: in response to Fonus's reply below, I am adding the following detail: My number was not sold to their VOIP provider (IRISTEL) which is who I had to deal with for porting it out; in fact, IRISTEL was surprised to note that the number had been sold to ANOTHER third-party. Also, I repeatedly sent the SAME information in my request to port and eventually it was accepted - the initial claim on their part that the address didn't match was never substantiated. All of this was NOT worth the meagre savings. Especially since I ended up paying for an extra month while dealing with them dragging their feet when I tried to leave.

Review.Pseudo: เกรแฮม รัดด์
Review.Titre: I gave Fonus a few months to impress me, but ended up cancelling my account.
Review.Contenu: OK - so I have gone from 3 stars (1st review - some months ago) to 5 stars in my second review after a few weeks of use. Today I canceled my account with Fonus after about 5 months of use. Here is why in no specific order.1st) Very unstable connection for mobile reception, I have missed numerous calls due to this problem. It appears you need to delete the Cache often to keep your device connected for voice calls.2nd) 2FA (Two Factor Authentication) = because Fonus is VOIP many if not all 2FA will not work with this system. This includes Online Banking, Brokerage firms, and many more. There are workarounds for some but not all. So Be Aware.3rd) Double Billing and extreme challenges changing your current billing, yes they will double bill you, you need to check your payment method frequently. Also if you need to change your payment method you basically need to start again, cancel your account and SIM then input the new billing information, very challenging.On the positive side, the Data is a good and very reasonable price. In the USA you get access to 5G so that would be a positive, but not available in Canada. Also, their customer service is very good, attentive, and helpful, however during an online help session the agent told me to "search the internet for a solution" for my issue. I did and found the solution, "Cancel my account".Not to say I would not come back to Fonus if they can improve the issues noted, but as of today, I am moving on to Shaw Mobile. Yes, I have heard the problems they have so you may hear more from me soon.

Review.Titre: Okay but with issues
Review.Contenu: Acceptable Service and Help is very quick .. Do not still have Call Forwarding though they IT help keeps informing me they "are working on it" and they cannot accept verification texts for 2 Step verification from certain agencies and banks which make it VERY frustrating.  Have used it in Canada and USA with mixed results but not tried anywhere else

Review.Titre: I did not like the message taking…
Review.Contenu: I did not like the message taking system, I received a message, and I could not hear or understand what the person was saying.

Review.Titre: The only things that I dislike is the…
Review.Contenu: The only things that I dislike is the fact that lots of 2fA won't work in that plan as well as the lack of option to hide our phone number when placing a call

Review.Titre: Fonus Administrative Issues & Quality of Service
Review.Contenu: I had an issue while we were away in Florida in Feb. 2023 where Fonus suspended our accounts due to non payment when in fact we were on automatic monthly USD credit card payment withdrawal which they blamed on an administrative error on their part. It took a few days to resolve the issue which effected our ability to communicate with family back home.  A second event was more problematic when Fonus changed its system back in July/Aug. & sent an e-mail to an address I don't use.  When I missed the deadline to switch over I found out my texts on Aug. 21st were not being received which caused some issues as I was having a known medical condition resurface & this caused others to worry needlessly because my text messages didn't go through in a timely manner.  Why didn't Fonus send me some type on warning through the cell phone system. The matter was eventually resolved but did require a lot of communication via e-mail with Fonus to set up this new plan & having the ability to function within the system again.  On the positive side, I made a couple of short telephone calls that worked much better than the past when calls were disconnected after several minutes & the lines were iffy at best.  Communication over e-mail is OK on straight forward issues but live over the phone discussions are required on more complex ones which Fonus seems to make almost impossible to have & led my wife to change service providers.  I have remained for the time because I use the Fonus system for mainly text messages at this point.

Review.Titre: so far so good
Review.Contenu: so far so goodhad a bit of a snag about 4 months ago when your company lines went down , and i didnt have any service for about 3 weeks, AND DIDNT GET CREDIT FOR TIME LOST.

Review.Titre: User Beware...  Probably best for a once in a while; while traveling phone
Review.Contenu: Have been with Fonus for several months now. Been working on and off. Not advisable for someone who isnt technically inclined. Service has been shut down right around christmas this year and has been harsh to all users. Not satsified with customer service either.

Review.Titre: Good option if I ignore the 12 hour network outage
Review.Contenu: Recent 12 hour Inteliquent network outage.  Can't receive calls or text's.  Interesting that I CAN make calls.Until this point it has been a good option for us travelling between Canada and Mexico.  Its a bit odd having to use their App for phoning, but it works.  The support via chat has been excellent.

Review.Titre: It works, sort of...
Review.Contenu: Got my sim and activated it, got a new number. My Issue is this is essentially a VOIP service, i can't make calls or send txt's without using their app. I really dislike having to use a separate app to use my phone as intended. So i doubt i'll continue using this service when my month is up. If they could seamlessly integrate the service into the standard functions of my android phone, it would be better.

Review.Titre: Bad phone calls and text services.  APP is a sad application
Review.Contenu: Setup is relatively simple, but the porting process takes a long time.  Never advise that I have to sign up a new temp number before I ask for porting process, and I  wait over 20 days and they told me my Cdn phone company rejected the porting which is not true.  I wasted one month's service fee with no service waiting for porting.  The phone calls got dropped most of the time, and texting is really bad using the APP.  I think I have to go back to my traditional service provider after my trip to the US.

Review.Titre: Fonus Mobile Canada
Review.Contenu: We are a family in Canada, wife and 2 adult children. We have been using Fonus since July 2022 with 4 mobile devices. I also convinced my best friend to switch. We have had problems since the very beginning including activations, reliability and billing. The billing issues are the most recent with 3 of the 5 plans being disconnected for no reason. Got those issues resolved quicker and less stress with each one as I learned how deal with it.Each time there has been problems, I have been assured quick resolutions which have never been the case.The only things which keep us from dropping Fonus like a brick are the vast quantity of data and the option to switch to any of the Canadian service providers on demand. If I travelled to the U.S. regularly, I'd add the no roaming fees and activations to that list. All in all, I have a love/hate for this company with hopes that they smooth out all their issues and become the benchmark for mobile service. On the other hand, perhaps another startup company will come out of the gate strong and compete directly with Fonus.

Review.Titre: The customer service is 10/10
Review.Contenu: The customer service is 10/10 The service itself is 4/10 basically, you get what you pay forOverall experience is 5/10This service is not a regular service,  this company runs only on DATA ,So when you make a call it's not like a regular call Everything is trough DATA so that SUCKS! also you have to use their STUPID app to send a text message,  or to make a call It's not worth the money in my opinion   Unless you don't plan to use the service,  And you only want to use it as DATA But to be honest even the data is very SLOW

Review.Pseudo: เกรแฮม รัดด์
Review.Titre: Beware of the Exchange Rate and the hidden fees.
Review.Contenu: OK - so I have only ORDERED the SIM card, the plan looks very good at $30 for all that Data, but you need to be aware of the exchange rate (I am in Canada). The original invoice was for the SIM card, $15.79 USD with tax, then when the charge goes to my CDN bank, is is for $16.58 USD this works out to $21.52 CDN, A little dear. Then they charge a separate charge of $1.00 USD ($1.29 CDN), which they now tell via their online chat, is an authorization charge, it will be credited back at some time. Now I am complaining about the exchange fees mostly, I am not certain if this is them or my bank, but the 1.29 rate for USD>CDN is very dear. This could be solved if they offered payment via PayPal (at least for me). I will continue to post the experiences with FONUS as I get my SIM and set up the APP.

Review.Titre: Fonus service is prompt and effective
Review.Contenu: Fonus service is prompt and effective. There were some minor problems because I tried to activate two numbers on the same account (different phones). It was fixed quickly. The app is a little clunky, lacking the ability to block calls, and create favorites. However it works well for calls and texts.

Review.Titre: Fonus App suggestion...
Review.Contenu: Notwithstanding the fact that one is able to break away from the strangle-hold by Canadian Telecoms, the service is pretty decent.  However, a safety issue... You need your app programmers to link you app with the default phone app dialing systems in Android (Samsung).  dialing from the phone in a vehicle is not only illegal but, down right dangerous.  You're people to be more stupid than they already are when dialing out in a car, etc.  Good luck with your ventures.

Review.Titre: Generally I am satisfied with the…
Review.Contenu: Generally I am satisfied with the service, and certainly the price.  A few downsides:- many institutions (eg. Banks) refuse to text authorization codes to VOIP numbers. This is the biggest downside for me.- The 'new' App lacks support for multi-party chats. You can send to multiple people, but then each reply and conversation is point to point- the 'automatic' switching of carriers is hit and miss when traveling between Canada and the U.S.

Review.Titre: FONUS is for real
Review.Contenu: FONUS is for real!  Imagine having access to call Canada, USA, and Mexico phone numbers WITHOUT roaming charges?!  My husband, with his "computer-guy" searching skill, stumbled upon Fonus which we now use, for $30 each per month.  Who would complain about unlimited data and text, NO ONE, duh!!! :)The only problem, which I think the company will be able to resolve soon, is that there are times when it's hard to get a signal, especially when you're on the go.

Review.Titre: Far and above the connection has been…
Review.Contenu: Far and above the connection has been great. So much better than other operators in Canada. Normally I was getting drops with an old carrier, but when I signed up again after trying out another carrier, this time I've connected fine for months.

Review.Titre: The last upgrade of Fonus is better on…
Review.Contenu: The last upgrade of Fonus is better on the phone side than the original offering.  I appreciate how quickly the help line is, although it was faster before the upgrade.Overall, I will stay with Fonus, but I wish they would offer a Canadian Dollar plan!

Review.Titre: Fonus  great for travelling
Review.Contenu: I love the fact that I can use the data in Canada, US, Mexico and recently in Portugal. Reasonable pricing on 3 plans. My only issue is the app still gives me problems sending and receiving calls. However, I use Google Voice mostly for that.

Review.Titre: Best value for your money and…
Review.Contenu: Best value for your money and convenience. You get data up to 20 GB, then it slows down and unlimited world wide calls and unlimited world wide roaming. That right there makes it worth it. Customer service is also usually good and crazy fast. The main issues are the fact it says “unlimited data” but once you get past 35ish GB of use, they threaten to shut off your service due to “fair use” agreement. So it’s not actually unlimited data and is very misleading. I’ve had this happen at least twice and my service even shut off altogether once. The old app was also very very buggy. The new app is much much better although sometimes texts don’t appear even after getting a notification for it and the only way the text will appear is if I open and close the window of the app repeatedly. The old app was terrible. Dropped calls, texts not sending or receiving and more.  Thankfully this new app is running relatively smooth. Overall good experience

Review.Titre: Major Improvement
Review.Contenu: Since we have been using the new sim cards the service has improved 300%. Good connections and no lost calls. There are still a few little glitches in trying to add and delete contacts. One problem is the fact that at this point I have to turn off WiFi to send an outgoing call. I don't think this is the situation with all phones.

Review.Titre: Text and browsing excellent
Review.Contenu: Messaging worked good. Had a problem with unnecessary large photos. Internet worked excellent. Fast download speed but there is a minimal delay playing online games. Phone call worked much better after installing codec that Roger's used with it's voip service.

Review.Titre: 4.5 out of 5
Review.Contenu: 4.5.  Mostly been great.  New app is a huge improvement. When Rogers went down mine automatically flipped to Bell and I didn't even notice. Tech support has been really good but i haven't needed them on months.

Review.Titre: Totally happy with Fonus
Review.Contenu: When I initially started using Fonus, I had a few quirks in getting it setup however, that was soon overcome by their 24/7 online support.  That said, connections to US and Europe numbers from Canada were easy and no lost calls.  This is quite a treat considering that Canadian telecoms are seriously overcharging.  When I travel to Europe, I'm sure one will get a chance to evaluate the service. Can't seem to connect the phone to my vehicle.  It receives calls but will not dial them. As for all the complainers, just a bunch of whiners.

Review.Titre: There are times the device takes over a…
Review.Contenu: There are times the device takes over a minute to provide internet. This seems to happen when it has been offline for a while, and needs to reconnect.

Review.Titre: The new SIM Card and the new app…
Review.Contenu: The new SIM Card and the new app improved tremendously our experience with Fonus.Also appreciate the price for value.

Review.Titre: It was easy to setup
Review.Contenu: It was easy to setup. I elected esim and got the servic setup right away. The only thing I don't like is if I have to use the service in one of my ten phones, I have to get new esims everytime.

Review.Titre: sometimes the signal is weak and i have…
Review.Contenu: sometimes the signal is weak and i have to contact you to resend or reset.

Review.Titre: Just want to say I've been using Fonus
Review.Contenu: Just want to say I've been using Fonus for over 6 months. If I had the ability I'd give four and a half stars out of five can't give five because nothing is perfect on this world but this is pretty darn close. So glad I signed up with this service I am using it all day long in my transportation job between calls music and podcasts and those things, Rock solid and keeps trucking all day all night long.

Review.Titre: The best but with a big issue
Review.Contenu: I live in Canada and here all plans are really expensive. This company offer 20Gb that works in 3 countries without pay extra, no other companies are offering something similar. But a big issue is Fonus disable the hotspot of your device, so you will no able to use it with your tablet or pc. For me that is a big disadvantage, but really Fonus continues being the best option here, probably in USA or Mex there are better or similar options.

Review.Titre: Fonus WOW! Great improvements!
Review.Contenu: Fonus has finally updated their app and Sim cards!  This occurred in August 2023.  The reliability of their service prior to this upgrades was just okay and not dependable.  I had several friends prior to these changes try out Fonus.  Some kept the service and others dropped it like a hot potato because of the reliability issue.  I had cancelled the service as well 2 weeks prior to the changes not realizing they were going to happen.Two of my friends who stuck with them advised me that after the changes Fonus was now reliable!  Not dropping any calls and the voice quality of the phone calls was now great.As I am going to do a lot of traveling around the world I decided to give them a second chance and a signed up with them again.  WOW what a difference.  The app is 100 percent better and the call quality is great.  No dropped calls. Now I can roam in 55 Countries and call 85 without paying anything extra! The only issued I have run into so far is that they advertise 5g service where available.  Well I live in Winnipeg where it is available and my phone is 5g capable.  I can not get any 5g signals from any of the companies that Fonus uses here.  Having said that the 4 g download/upload speeds are decent 83 down and 5.3 up.  Would like to know where 5g is available though?As long as the service stays the same or improves I'll be quite happy staying with it for a very long time!

Review.Titre: Dishonest Advertising
Review.Contenu: I would have given them a 5 star, but they need to be more honest about their pricing. Their main webpage advertise service for $30 per month. Only after ordering the SIM card and activiting, do they reveal that there is an additional $1.58 "Fonus Mobile Administrative Fee" consisting of 2.9%: credit card authorization and processing fees, 2%: telecommunications regulatory fees and 0.35%: e911 fees. This is not a lot more, but the right thing to do is reveal ALL fees before a potential client orders a SIM card.

Review.Titre: My initial hookup went bad
Review.Contenu: My initial hookup went bad. Mostly my fault. Until I talk to a service technician that was very good and knowledgeable. He hooked me up at 1:30 amAugust 23, 2022.  Fonus made my anniversary date the day I received my sim. But my phone number got ported in on August 22 which Fonus picked this date.  Working on a solution with Fonus.  Great sound great text.  Data works perfect

Review.Titre: I was enjoying my service and now have…
Review.Contenu: I was enjoying my service and now have had no texts or calls every time I talk to someone I get told they are working on it!! Last night at 8pm was told expecting it back in 12 hrs still nothing ...I really need my phone !!Customer service on chat has been helpful ..

Review.Titre: I have been using the service for 2…
Review.Contenu: I have been using the service for 2 years in Canada and USA. It is overall great . Since Dec 15,2022 I have not been able to text out nor receive texts. Secondly I can only make outgoing calls with fonus. I cannot receive calls since Dec. 16,2022. When I try to contact customer service ,I get an automated message that all agents are busy due to high volume. It says they are aware of an outage and working on it. This is the 3 days with no text and no incoming calls.As of Dec 31,2022 all services from Fonus ( talk, text and Data) have been working properly again for me.  Customer service was great throughout the service crash.

Review.Titre: For me it is a much cheaper option
Review.Contenu: For me it is a much cheaper option. I live 6 months in Niagara and 6 in South Florada so a no brainer. The issue I have is while in Niagara we have poor cell service on Lake Ontario and I get 1 bar of data and with that it’s not enough to allow wifi calling!?! All calls ring but drop. But I can call the number back, go figure. My network stays on AT+T and does not use Rogers or Bell, maybe because I’m so close to the US?!? Text work fine. Speed when not at home is good.

Review.Titre: Excellent alternative to expensive…
Review.Contenu: Excellent alternative to expensive Canadian plans for travel. Text data are very good.  The cell can have issues.

Review.Titre: All is Well
Review.Contenu: Could not receive calls, send or receive texts, data was OK, for 2 weeks.  Suddenly, today, everything works again. What a relief!

Review.Titre: Rocky start, but Great working service!
Review.Contenu: Rocky start. But it's going and getting bigger.  Happily using the service and appreciating it.  Now I can easily keep in touch with my family in the U.S. and use data as I need without having to worry about it. I look forward to seeing where fonus goes, and I'll be there the whole way.Will recommend it once it passes the 3 month mark of service.Good Luck Fonus and all the best!

Review.Titre: Rough start, Good working service
Review.Contenu: Honestly a Rough start.  a too good to be true vibe from it.  However, looking at profit margins from the telcos you can see this is a very achievable price point, even profitable.Good plan for Canadians and Americans looking to save.  I've been using it for couple months now with no issues.  At one point I had an issue with Text messaging but that was because I messed up my phone settings.  Once I fixed it, works no problem.Currently the plan works for North America. It's a work in progress to get Global Calling/Texting/Data.Looking forward to where this company goes.

Review.Titre: Data and text works great in Canada, voice is a bit delayed

Review.Titre: An impressive young company
Review.Contenu: I purchased my SIM card on February 2 and was delivered mid June; this was quite a while even with COVID-19 going on. I understand this has been resolved. This is a young company that is still ironing out all of the little details that a telecommunications company needs to figure out; I have experienced a couple service interruptions; a few hours while some behind the scenes work was done, and once being throttled; it was quickly fixed by a message through Telegram to the CEO Simon Tian. I anxiously wait all the future improvements that are planned; a VOIP application (Canadian number support), full world wide local based service (no roaming), and an unlimited, unthrottled, hotspot compatible data connection.

Review.Titre: Legit and perfectly fonctionnal
Review.Contenu: Legit and perfectly fonctionnal ! Some limitation but perfect for the Price

Review.Titre: Good deal and customer service, TERRIBLE software and it's a virtual phone app
Review.Contenu: The fonus offering is unheard of in Canada - a north american unlimited plan with a local number provided. However, what I hadn't realized is that they give you unlimited data and from that you use it to call and text from a fonus app - not from your native phone software. I thought that app was optional somehow.Every aspect of setting this up was untenable, other than the customer service. I couldn't get the sim because I was in some UI infinite loop on their site. I had to order it through Amazon. Activating the sim caused some mysterious 404 error where I was an unknown user for some API of an american voip service. I had to use a different email and my incognito tab. Now I have two separate accounts, but the new one has a email provided password I can't reset because of some unexplained 401 error, given I can use the password to log in. So I'm stuck with the security compromise of having this unencrypted password in my email. Another email told me to put the wrong name into the APN. It was not clear from the email or anywhere that I'd be dependent on this Fonus app. It took me over an hour to set this up today. If they didn't have rapid response chat help I wouldn't have made it through. I kind of resent I did. The deal was too good to pass up. Now I'm just waiting for my number to port over and I'm hoping that's the last I have to do of setup; that I can just coast on some good savings now.Update - ah, my password did update to the new one, even thought it said otherwise. Ok, less concerned about security of my payment method now...I have a feeling that over time as I travel more I'll be really happy I chose this.

Review.Titre: Start up growing pains, but delivered on service
Review.Contenu: Fonus had some growing pains, as it originally promised unlimted everything, everywhere, with roaming around the world.It may have launched a bit too soon in November 2019 which has left quite a few of the early adopters very disgruntled as they didn't get what they hoped for right away.   Covid-19 played a part in the delays as most SIM cards were shipped from China, and did not get delivered until Apr-June 2020.   Some roaming agreements may have fell through, as once SIM cards starting getting activated, service is only available in the US/Canada/Mexico.   Simon, the CEO, is on track to have worldwide roaming in place with a future update.Nonetheless, in Canada the Fonus SIM is fantastic.  It roams on all 3.5 of the major carriers (Bell, Telus, Rogers, and Freedom Mobile) with LTE speeds.  It will automatically select the network that has the strongest signal and adapt as needed.   In Toronto, I've reached 300Mbit speeds with Telus.There will be future updates such as a VoIP app as a way to have a Canadian number and the ability to port numbers to it.  Currently, you can only get a US number, and there is no ability to port non-US numbers.   This will change to a data-only SIM, with the VoIP app.   In addition, future roaming agreements are supposedly coming to allow for extended roaming in more countries.In Canada at least, the value is there as a $30 USD/month plan with unlimited data on all 3.5 carriers is tremendous value.   Right now, it might be best suited in dual-SIM phones though due to not being able to port over your Canadian number.If you need lots of data, there is good value in the service, and eventually the future updates will make it something very unique in the Canadian market.

Review.Titre: Rough Start But Getting Smoother
Review.Contenu: So from the start Fonus had a rocky start which really hindered the Brand of Fonus.I was 1 of the 500 to snag a Lifetime plan when they first got mentioned.Once I got my sim it was as simple as getting my ICCID and IMEI for the hookup with either a Fonus Support Agent or Mr.Tian for the the Lifetime service and i was rocking within 20 minutes.Fonus has been my goto over my actual BellMts plan I have here in Canada due to the True Unlimited Data they Offer as any other Canadian providers seem to just nickel and dime you out of all your hard earned Cash.Coverage is very massive although I admit I personally have not fully traveled to test out more of the region I am located in but their is many others who have been testing with great results.Speeds vary depending on the time of day as i would expect it to with any other provider.Anywhere from 25mbps up to a whopping 200mbps+ depending on your location to the service tower in your areas.The support is available when you need it with Fonus!!I use Fonus as my spare day to day for anything I really could think of.There are still hiccups here and there but those growing pains are normal with a Up and coming business in this day and age.As a service recipient since June 2020 I have been very pleased with my overall experience in the time I have had it.Would I drop my BellMts plans?-Not just yet as Canadain Number Porting is not fulling implemented quite yet but it has been a critical focal point for Fonus.Pros-Great Support-Quick Service -Not locked into a Contract / Cancel Anytime you want/needCons-No Fonus App Yet (coming roughly soonish)-Must Contact support if your data gets throttled-Some issues with certain devices Picking your CarrierCritical Thoughts-Give it a try for a month and see how it suits your needs as you could be surprised on how well it suits you.Just a short review from my experience so far.Could change as more progress forward happens.

You do have to get used to the change to always using the FONUS app for calls and texts but it has work smoothly for us.  It picks up all you contacts from your Google Account.We are in a Rural area of British Columbia and the Cell became active in just a few minutes at LTE speed.  It has worked in other cities in BC and Alberta we have travelled to at LTE or 5G speed and we are now in Nuevo Vallarta MX and it worked just 2 minutes after landing and is currently shown on the Telcel network at LTE speed.So all as described so far and we are happy with the way the FONUS app works.

Review.Titre: Fonus is A ok in my books. After a bit of frustration with the…

I vented my frustration on a public forum, and believe it or not somebody chimed in from Fonus. Let’s call him “Simon”. Simon says (no pun intended.) Leave it to him and he will track down the billing information. After a short period of time Simon got back to me and told me that they had over billed me for two months , and that was going to be remedied. Oh my gosh within a matter of a few days the money is back in my account and I am so happy with that turn of events. Fonus is definitely OK in my books.

Review.Titre: There are limits to unlimited using Fonus.
Review.Contenu: While visiting in Carmel New York the cable internet went out for two days. So I decided to stream Netflix and Xfinity Stream over my Fonus data plan using apps on my phone. To my surprise I was not throttled over AT&T. In Canada I am always throttled to 512kb once I hit 20GB so I never go over 20GB by much. Toronto is home. After using almost 40 GB of data. I received this e-mail. Hi there,This message serves to inform you that your account's data usage is greater than 99.5% of all Service customers and has been deemed excessive, indicative of our service being used as a home internet replacement.This is in direct violation of our Fonus' FUP (fair use policy). You may find the FUP on our "Privacy & Legal" page, at trust pilot does not allow links.Here is the excerpt of the FUP relevant to your situation:"Fonus Mobile Service and any related data services are provided solely for purposes of web browsing, messaging, and similar activities. You are responsible for all data activity from and to your device regardless of who initiates the activity. You may not be allowed to use the Fonus Mobile Service with applications and systems that drive continuous heavy data sessions and generate excessive amounts of traffic. We reserve the right to limit, suspend or terminate without notice any misuse of our network or violation of these Service Terms and Conditions."Please reduce your data consumption immediately and significantly; and use Wi-Fi whenever possible to avoid suspension of service. Fonus has the right to not renew our month to month service agreements if it deems excessive use is contributing to network congestion.We thank you for your understanding and apologize for any inconveniences caused.- Fonus Customer ServiceFor questions, chat with our 24/7 support team at fonusmobile.com. I have now tuned off my phone until my next billing cycle. if you plan on streaming video or use your device for heavy data do not go ever 20GB. The term unlimited data does not mean you can use the service like your home internet connection. It clearly states that in this e-mail.
